content:
• Friday, April 5, 2013
  • GOL

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GOL +6%. PSUN +6%. MEET +3.5%. RIGL +3.3%. CIA +2.5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GOL +6%. PSUN +6%. MEET +3.5%. RIGL +3.3%. CIA +2.5%.
    After-hours top losers: HNR -7.6%. BTH -6.3%. SYRG -6%. MM -5.7%. EVC -4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TLT +4.3%. WPS +3.7%. UNG +2.6%. VNQ +2.4%. IYR +1.8%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TLT +4.3%. WPS +3.7%. UNG +2.6%. VNQ +2.4%. IYR +1.8%.
    ETF Losers: GDXJ -8.0%. GDX -7.4%. URA -6.7%. EWY -6.2%. REMX -5.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • PRGNF

    Paragon Shipping (PRGN) says it's voluntarily transferring its listing to the NASDAQ Global...

    Paragon Shipping (PRGN) says it's voluntarily transferring its listing to the NASDAQ Global Market from the NYSE in an effort to achieve greater long-term flexibility and cost efficiency. The company expects its common stock to begin trading on NASDAQ on April 19, under its current symbol "PRGN". It's common stock will continue to trade on the NYSE until the transfer is completed. Shares +2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +1.4%) reports the completion of a "straightforward and uneventful" 787 certification...

    Boeing (BA +1.4%) reports the completion of a "straightforward and uneventful" 787 certification demonstration flight today today with a Boeing-owned production airplane built for LOT Polish Airlines. Today's flight marks the final certification test for the new battery system, and completes the required FAA testing. BA now plans to gather and analyze the data and submit the required materials to the agency for further dialog.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 15 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Another Friday, another rally for well-shorted Internet stocks. Though Zynga (ZNGA +3.2%) may...

    Another Friday, another rally for well-shorted Internet stocks. Though Zynga (ZNGA +3.2%) may have benefited from news it's adding John Doerr to its board, most Internet names with large short interests that posted big gains did so in the absence of major news. Groupon (GRPN +5.9%), a frequent participant in such rallies, was among the standouts, as were Yelp (YELP +8.5%), Zillow (Z +3.8%), and OpenTable (OPEN +4.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • ZBH

    Zimmer Holdings (ZMH -1.9%) slips today as Credit Suisse cuts their estimates on the company's...

    Zimmer Holdings (ZMH -1.9%) slips today as Credit Suisse cuts their estimates on the company's Q1 and its reiterated Neutral on the shares. The firm says that it's at the high-end of guidance range, and U.S. knee/hip market growth needs to be more carefully watched. The company lowers its 2013/2014/2015 EPS estimates to $5.74/$6.24/$6.83, from $5.76/$6.30/$6.92 respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • SYNA

    A bullish Pac Crest note is helping Synaptics (SYNA +2.8%) finish higher in spite of a tech...

    A bullish Pac Crest note is helping Synaptics (SYNA +2.8%) finish higher in spite of a tech selloff. The firm sees rising demand for tablets and more expensive touchpads (such as the ones enabling Win. 8 multi-touch gestures?) offsetting weak notebook demand. Needham upgraded Synaptics last month, citing strong smartphone touch sensor momentum.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • OGXPY

    Shares in Brazil's OGX Petroleum (OTCPK:OGXPY -13.2%) slump as much as 17%, bringing its...

    Shares in Brazil's OGX Petroleum (OTCPK:OGXPY -13.2%) slump as much as 17%, bringing its one-year plunge to near 90%, after the company controlled by billionaire Eike Batista had its credit rating cut by S&P. Adding to the poor sentiment is a Thursday report that Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff had refused to aid Batista's companies, which include LLX Logistica, now constructing the multibillion-dollar Acu Port.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • AFL

    A moderate late-session bounce in the S&P isn't helping many in the insurance sector stuck...

    A moderate late-session bounce in the S&P isn't helping many in the insurance sector stuck near the day's lows. Of particular interest is Aflac (AFL -4.1%) as the yen slides and the JGB market encountered a brutal selloff last night. The company presumably has significant exposure to both, but also presumably is hedged? PRU -3.4%, HIG -3.2%, LNC -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • GTXI

    Cancer-focused biotech GTx (GTXI +7.1%) moves higher on double its 10-day average volume after...

    Cancer-focused biotech GTx (GTXI +7.1%) moves higher on double its 10-day average volume after Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage with a Buy rating citing "a potentially significant value-creating event … with the pending Enobosarm Phase 3 data." Price target is $7, representing a 40% upside from the stock's current price. 

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISSC

    Innovative Solutions (ISSC +31.2%) rises dramatically on the session after announcing Delta has...

    Innovative Solutions (ISSC +31.2%) rises dramatically on the session after announcing Delta has placed a $60M order for a "fleet wide retrofit" with ISSC "advanced flight management systems, integrated standby systems, and primary flight displays." The order increases ISSC's backlog to over $100M. 

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • TEX

    Terex (TEX -2.8%) is downgraded to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, which cites increased concerns...

    Terex (TEX -2.8%) is downgraded to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, which cites increased concerns about the market for construction cranes. In addition to sluggish U.S. capital investment trends pressuring demand for TEX's products, the firm sees further deterioration in EU construction trends weighing on crane demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • SRPT

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Sarepta's (SRPT +5.3%) earlier data update on its Phase IIb study of...

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Sarepta's (SRPT +5.3%) earlier data update on its Phase IIb study of on eteplirsen saying its very encouraged as there are no treatment options for DMD. The primary near-term value driver in the stock is SRPT's decision to file for accelerated approval later this month. Piper projects a 50/50 chance it will be able to file on existing data.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR +4.8%) rallies after yesterday's move to add two independent directors to...

    Nabors Industries (NBR +4.8%) rallies after yesterday's move to add two independent directors to its board under pressure from its largest shareholder, Pamplona Capital. NBR CEO Anthony Petrello says the board is evaluating strategies to enhance shareholder value, including improving its capital structure, reviewing its mix of businesses and improving operating performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOL

    Gol Linhas (GOL -3.1%) slips again today, continuing its decline from yesterday after Fitch cut...

    Gol Linhas (GOL -3.1%) slips again today, continuing its decline from yesterday after Fitch cut its ratings on it and its fully owned subsidiaries to B- with a negative outlook. Fitch cites GOL's GOL's deteriorating credit profile, driven by poor operational results and the expectation of limited recovery in cash flow generation during 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • ACHC

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -2.8%) slips today in spite of BAML raising estimates and upping its...

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -2.8%) slips today in spite of BAML raising estimates and upping its price target on the shares from $36 to $37. The firm says ACHC's purchased two facilities, one in Puerto Rico and the other in Florida, both of which offer the opportunity for bed expansions and the potential for more upside in the out years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • ACUR

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +6.3%) get a big boost from yesterday's announcement...

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +6.3%) get a big boost from yesterday's announcement of a patent award for its Aversion polymer matrix technology, which is designed to reduce the potential abuse of opiod and other drugs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Select coal stocks are on the move following a bullish note from Goldman Sachs, which predicts...

    Select coal stocks are on the move following a bullish note from Goldman Sachs, which predicts 10% Y/Y gains in demand for thermal coal as a result of less coal-to-gas switching; the higher forecast reflects an improved outlook for natural gas prices and normalized storage. ANR +3.8%, ACI +3.1%, CNX +2.7%, BTU +0.9%, CLD +0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 8 Comments
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -1.8%) loses steam with the rest of the overall market despite its...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -1.8%) loses steam with the rest of the overall market despite its announcement that it was initiating dosing in a Phase 1 clinical trial of APD334, a potential treatment of autoimmune diseases. The trial is set to evaluate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of single-ascending doses of APD334 in up to 64 volunteers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +4.1%) is trekking higher after SA contributor Brandon Osborne argues in detail...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +4.1%) is trekking higher after SA contributor Brandon Osborne argues in detail why the mobile game developer should beat a Q1 EPS consensus of -$0.07. Citing Glu's long history of EPS beats, its success rate and average daily revenue for past game launches, favorable sell-side commentary about the performance of new games, improving margins/monetization, and the success of Mac game launches, Osborne expects Q1 EPS of at least -$0.04, and considers a profit possible.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +8.2%) is still not a buy despite providing more clarity...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +8.2%) is still not a buy despite providing more clarity following an earnings restatement and updated reserve figures in Venezuela, Wunderlich says. The firm remains convinced HNR is "essentially a binary, event-driven name" and prefers to watch from the sidelines.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • JNPR

    A downgrade to Equalweight from Barclays is contributing to Juniper's (JNPR -5.3%) post-F5...

    A downgrade to Equalweight from Barclays is contributing to Juniper's (JNPR -5.3%) post-F5 losses. The downgrade comes a day after Juniper announced its highly programmable EX9200 data center switch, which (like the Contrail Systems deal) drives home a software-defined networking strategy of emphasizing interoperability with 3rd-party offerings (in contrast to Cisco's more proprietary approach). Juniper asserts the EX9200, which uses a home-grown ASIC, is "designed to support all known protocols today and all unknown protocols for the next decade."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ENMD

    Investors give the thumbs-up to EntreMed's (ENMD +1.4%) decision today to name Ken K. Ren as...

    Investors give the thumbs-up to EntreMed's (ENMD +1.4%) decision today to name Ken K. Ren as chief executive officer, after completing a one year stint as interim CEO. The company also names James Huang and Y. Alexander Wu as new members of the company's board of directors.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • TDC

    Stifel upgrades Teradata (TDC +1.4%) to Buy a day after shares tumbled on account of getting...

    Stifel upgrades Teradata (TDC +1.4%) to Buy a day after shares tumbled on account of getting pulled from Morgan Stanley's Best Ideas list. That's helping Teradata bounce a little off its 52-week lows, and avoid the general rout in enterprise IT stocks taking place in the wake of F5's warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +17.4%) pops on news that six deaths in China have been linked to...

    BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +17.4%) pops on news that six deaths in China have been linked to a new strain of avian flu. BCRX is developing peramivir, which has been shown in preclinical studies to help treat highly virulent strains of influenza - including the bird flu strain known as the H5N1 virus. Other drug stocks moving higher on the news: Pure Bioscience (OTC:PURE +15.6%), Hemispherx BioPharma (HEB +13.3%), Sinovac Biotech (SVA +7.8%), and Novavax (NVAX +1.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +5.5%) racks up solid gains today after the therapeutic drug...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +5.5%) racks up solid gains today after the therapeutic drug developer announced positive updated data from its Phase IIb study of eteplirsen in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Results at 74 weeks showed a continued stabilization of walking ability in eteplirsen-treated patients on a 6-minute walk test.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • PICO

    Pico Holdings (PICO +8.3%) jumps after its subsidiary UCP files for $125M IPO. Preliminary...

    Pico Holdings (PICO +8.3%) jumps after its subsidiary UCP files for $125M IPO. Preliminary filings suggest the shares will list on the NYSE under the ticker "UCP." The anticipated share price was not disclosed. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett (BBG +5.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, which believes the...

    Bill Barrett (BBG +5.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, which believes the surplus in natural gas is over and prices should rise to the upper end of $4.00-$4.50 per MMBtu. Goldman says BBG is "in the early stages of an improving resource base trading at an attractive valuation likely to be supported by rising gas prices." COG +2.5%, SWN +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • EVR

    Remember the supposed pickup in the M&A cycle, asks PAA Research, noting continued damage in...

    Remember the supposed pickup in the M&A cycle, asks PAA Research, noting continued damage in the boutique investment bank sector which mostly rolled over several weeks ago. EVR -5%, GHL -2.8%, SF -3.2%, OPY -1.6%, PJC -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • UPI

    Uroplasty (UPI -6.6%) slides after announcing the resignation of CEO David Kaysen. The company...

    Uroplasty (UPI -6.6%) slides after announcing the resignation of CEO David Kaysen. The company also guided below estimates for both Q4 and FY13 revenue. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • ZNH

    Worries about an outbreak of bird flu in China hammer Asian airline stocks. In Hong Kong trading...

    Worries about an outbreak of bird flu in China hammer Asian airline stocks. In Hong Kong trading and in New York, China Southern Airlines (ZNH -8.1%) and China Eastern Airlines (CEA -6.8%) are taking the hardest hits.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -1.4%) could strike iRadio deals with Warner Music and Universal within the next...

    Apple (AAPL -1.4%) could strike iRadio deals with Warner Music and Universal within the next week, CNET's Paul Sloan reports. He adds Apple's service will provide studios with fresh monetization options, such as a cut of audio ad revenue and an option for users to buy songs they're listening to. In-line with earlier reports, Apple is said to be baking in unique features, such as "the ability to jump back to the beginning of a song." Last week, The Verge reported Apple is shooting for a summer launch, while noting the music industry has a "love-hate relationship" with Pandora (P -3.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 18 Comments
  • VIAV

    The bloodletting in enterprise IT and telecom equipment names that followed F5's March quarter...

    The bloodletting in enterprise IT and telecom equipment names that followed F5's March quarter warning yesterday afternoon has spread, with some telecom component/chip names now among the companies getting hit hard. This morning's weak NFP report certainly isn't helping matters. JDSU -5%. CVLT -6.1%. EZCH -4.5%. INFA -3.9%. QLIK -3.9%. MLNX -3.6%. CAVM -8.5%. RKUS -5%. FTNT -3.9%. FNSR -6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • JCP

    In an interesting twist, J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) CEO Ron Johnson took longtime critic (and former...

    In an interesting twist, J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) CEO Ron Johnson took longtime critic (and former CEO) Allen Questrom on a tour of a prototype store in Dallas last week in an effort to show the him the futuristic shop-in-shop look the retailer plans. Questrom hasn't comment publicly yet if his opinion of the retailer has been altered. Shares of JCP are a rare sight, adding 2.2% as the broad market capitulates.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 5 Comments
  • ENB

    Enbridge (ENB -3.2%) opens lower after announcing last night it had entered into an agreement...

    Enbridge (ENB -3.2%) opens lower after announcing last night it had entered into an agreement with RBC and TD Securities to sell 10.85M treasury common shares, on a bought deal basis, at $46.11/share for distribution to the public. Proceeds will be used to fund recently announced projects, pay down debt, and general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • RDWR

    Less than 24 hours after bigger rival F5 issued a March quarter warning, Radware (NASDAQ:RDWR)...

    Less than 24 hours after bigger rival F5 issued a March quarter warning, Radware (NASDAQ:RDWR) has done the same. The application delivery controller/security hardware vendor says it expects Q1 revenue of $45M and EPS of $0.30, below a consensus of $49.2M and $0.42. Weak EMEA and Chinese sales are blamed; U.S. sales are said to be strong. Shares -16.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) CEO Sheldon Adelson testified in a Las Vegas courtroom that a Hong...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) CEO Sheldon Adelson testified in a Las Vegas courtroom that a Hong Kong businessman claiming the company owed him $328M didn't deliver the goods in helping the casino player land a permit in Macau. Mixing business with testimony, a rather ho-hum courtroom proceeding was shaken up when Adelson almost caused a mistrial by presenting promotional brochures for his convention business while on the stand. LVS -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA) says the pending restatement of prior financial results has not been...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA) says the pending restatement of prior financial results has not been completed by the deadline for continued listing on the NASDAQ Global Select Market. The restatements stem from a revenue recognition issue and the company says it will complete the process as soon "as practicable." Shares -10% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • XIDEQ

    Premarket gainers: XIDE +31%. NIHD +10%. NVAX +5%. Losers: RIGL -36%. FFIV -18%. RDWR -18%. JNPR...

    Premarket gainers: XIDE +31%. NIHD +10%. NVAX +5%.
    Losers: RIGL -36%. FFIV -18%. RDWR -18%. JNPR -7%. CBMX -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RIGL) plummets before the bell after adverse side effects were...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RIGL) plummets before the bell after adverse side effects were observed in a late-stage clinical trial of AstraZeneca's (NYSE:AZN) rheumatoid arthritis drug fostamatinib. It also appears the drug may be inferior to AbbVie's Humira in terms of efficacy. The drug is licensed from Rigel whose shares are -35% premarket on heavy volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE) +34.3% premarket after yesterday's 47.5% plunge. The battery...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE) +34.3% premarket after yesterday's 47.5% plunge. The battery manufacturer announced last night it hired Lazard to review financing options to maximize shareholder value and that it expects FQ4 free cash flow generation to exceed previous guidance. Maxim defends the stock, and believes the current difficulties are temporary.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • NIHD

    NII Holdings (NASDAQ:NIHD) jumps before the bell after announcing it will sell its assets in...

    NII Holdings (NASDAQ:NIHD) jumps before the bell after announcing it will sell its assets in Peru for $400M. The sale will help the company focus on its two key markets in Brazil and Mexico. It's been a volatile 48 hours for the stock after a Peruvian news source leaked the sale on Wednesday and put the purchase price at $500M. The shares fell -10% Thursday and are +10% premarket today. 

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • FFIV

    Lazard cuts its price target on F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) to $100 from $115 following yesterday's AH Q2...

    Lazard cuts its price target on F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) to $100 from $115 following yesterday's AH Q2 warning. The related commentary was somewhat upbeat however as analyst Ryan Hutchison says the profit warning wasn't "company-specific" and notes F5 should benefit from "several meaningful tailwinds" including a "major product refresh and Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) exit from the market." Nonetheless, shares are -17% premarket. 

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • WEN

    Shares of Wendy's (NYSE:WEN) slip 2.5% in premarket trading after the restaurant stock takes a...

    Shares of Wendy's (NYSE:WEN) slip 2.5% in premarket trading after the restaurant stock takes a few shots from Jim Cramer on the lightning round of Mad Money last night. Of a beefier note, Janney Capital's main restaurant analyst trimmed his estimate for Wendy's Q1 same-store sales to 1.5% from 2%. (video)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • CELG

    Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) gets an upgrade from Deutsche Bank to Buy from Hold. The bank says survey...

    Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) gets an upgrade from Deutsche Bank to Buy from Hold. The bank says survey data gathered from 100 dermatologists and rheumatologists suggests Apremilast is a "blockbuster." DB raises its price target from $105 to $143. Shares +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • ATRS

    Antares Pharma (NASDAQ:ATRS) gets a Notice of Allowance from the U.S. Patent Trade Office...

    Antares Pharma (NASDAQ:ATRS) gets a Notice of Allowance from the U.S. Patent Trade Office regarding the company's patent application for the VIBEX QuickShot. ATRS said Thursday that the first shipment of the auto-injector devices will be on their way to Teva (NYSE:TEVA) by the end of Q1. Shares +2% premarket. 

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • KMB

    Kimberly Clark (NYSE:KMB) is downgraded to Underperform from Market Perform by BMO Capital on...

    Kimberly Clark (NYSE:KMB) is downgraded to Underperform from Market Perform by BMO Capital on valuation concerns after the defensive stock became a favored name this year. The firm has a $92 price target on shares. KMB -0.5% premarket to $97.95.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM | 1 Comment

  • S&P 500 (SPY) futures slide 0.5% and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ) -0.5% ahead of this mornings non-farm...

    S&P 500 (SPY) futures slide 0.5% and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ) -0.5% ahead of this mornings non-farm payroll report. Europe is tumbling for a 2nd day, the Stoxx 50 (FEZ) -1.3%, led by Germany (EWG) -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 AM | 1 Comment

  • European shares are mixed as investors await U.S. employment data , with higher-than-expected...

    European shares are mixed as investors await U.S. employment data , with higher-than-expected weekly jobless claims yesterday causing a few jitters. Comments from BNP's William de Vijlder encapsulate how distorted the thinking has become. "On the one hand we have evidence of growth, but at the same time...surprisingly strong data would quickly be met with a market reaction that QE is going to stop," de Vijlder says. EU Stoxx 50 +0.2%, London -0.6%, Paris +0.1%, Frankfurt -0.2%, Madrid +1%, Milan +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 AM

  • While Japanese shares rose, stocks in the rest of Asia suffered ahead of U.S. nonfarm payroll...

    While Japanese shares rose, stocks in the rest of Asia suffered ahead of U.S. nonfarm payroll data and after weekly jobless claims disappointed yesterday. Hong Kong equities fell sharply amid reports of deaths from avian flu, with airline stocks particularly affected. South Korean shares again dropped as North Korea continued with its brinkmanship, while the weak yen hurt auto shares. Hong Kong -2.6%, China closed, India -0.1%, South Korea -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 AM

  • Japanese shares jumped as high as 4.7% and passed the psychologically important 13,000 level for...

    Japanese shares jumped as high as 4.7% and passed the psychologically important 13,000 level for the first time since August 2008 before pulling back somewhat to close +1.6% at 12,834 as investors cashed in. Shares continued to be boosted by the BOJ's plan for aggressive monetary easing, which also pushed the yen to as low as 97 to the dollar before the rate moderated to ¥96.39.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 AM
